checkAndSettlePolicy(uint256,uint256).details: This function uses a placeholder for oracle integration

params._currentFuelPrice: The current fuel price (placeholder for oracle data)  TODO: Replace _currentFuelPrice parameter with Chainlink Functions oracle call The oracle should fetch real-time fuel price data from a reliable API source Example integration point for Chainlink Functions: - Set up Chainlink Functions subscription - Create JavaScript source code to fetch fuel price from API - Handle the oracle response in a callback function - Remove the _currentFuelPrice parameter once oracle is integrated
params._policyId: The ID of the policy to settle

constructor.details: Constructor sets the USDC token address and initializes ownership

params._usdcToken: Address of the USDC token contract

returns._0: Current USDC balance of the contract
Policy struct containing all policy details
Array of policy IDs owned by the user

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

purchasePolicy(uint256,uint256).details: User pays a fixed premium to get coverage against fuel price increases

params._expirationTimestamp: The timestamp when the policy expires
params._strikePrice: The fuel price that triggers payout (in fixed-point format, e.g., 3050 for 30.50 GHS)

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

withdrawFunds(uint256).details: Allows contract owner to withdraw funds for operational purposes

PAYOUT_AMOUNT().notice: Fixed payout amount in USDC (scaled by 6 decimals for USDC)

PREMIUM_AMOUNT().notice: Fixed premium amount in USDC (scaled by 6 decimals for USDC)

USDC_TOKEN().notice: USDC token contract interface for premium/payout handling

checkAndSettlePolicy(uint256,uint256).notice: Check and settle a policy based on current fuel price

getUserPolicies(address).notice: Get all policy IDs for a specific user

policies(uint256).notice: Mapping to store all policies by their ID

policyCounter().notice: Counter for creating unique policy IDs

userPolicies(address,uint256).notice: Mapping to store policy IDs owned by each address
